ai.summary: Black Trail is a short, easy hike in the UK, covering about 1.2 km. It’s suitable for families and casual walkers, featuring a flat or gently graded path and minimal elevation gain. Region is unspecified.
ai.terrain_summary: The trail is short and mostly flat, with well-maintained paths. Expect grass or compact dirt, with occasional roots or small steps. Minimal elevation gain makes it accessible for beginners.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy footwear and stay on marked paths. UK weather can be changeable; bring a light rain jacket. Carry sufficient water and a small snack, sun protection in sunny conditions, and a basic first-aid item. Let someone know your route and be cautious around other walkers, especially on narrow sections.
recommended_gear: Comfortable walking shoes or light hiking boots
Weather-appropriate clothing (layered, plus a lightweight rain jacket)
Map or GPS device / smartphone with offline map
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) offer milder, drier conditions in the UK; winter can be cold and wet.

seo.title: Black Trail — Easy 1.2 km Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Experience Black Trail, a short and easy 1.2 km hike in the UK. Learn terrain details, safety tips, gear essentials, and the best seasons for this quick outdoor walk.
